Class LatchData

java.lang.Object
  |
  +--LatchData
public class LatchData
extends java.lang.Object

A LatchData records both a value and the local time it was assigned. If no value is recored after a configured timeout duration, then the immediately next value assignment is ignored and the timeout is reset. The intent is to ignore spurious, infrequent assignments.

Constructor Summary
LatchData()
          Create a new instance with a latch_timeout of 20 seconds.
LatchData(double latch_timeout)
          Create a new instance with the specified latch_timeout.

is_latched

public boolean is_latched(double current_time)
Determine if the next value assignment latches or assigns.
Parameters:
current_time - in seconds
Returns:
true if the next value assignment actually assigns; false if the next value assignment only latches

set_latch_timeout

public void set_latch_timeout(double latch_timeout)
Set the latch timeout period.
Parameters:
latch_timeout - in seconds

set_value

public void set_value(double val)
Set the value or just latch. The assignment actually only occurs if is_latched is true for the current system time.
Parameters:
val - the value to assign

public void clear()
Clears the recorded latch time, value time, and value.

Returns:
current value

get_value_time

public double get_value_time()
Get the assignment time of the value that was last assigned during a latched state.
Returns:
value assignment time in seconds
